meanings.definition: Expressing or feeling disapproval or opposition.
meanings.sent1: She was objecting to the new rule.
meanings.sent2: The objecting student raised her hand to voice her disagreement.
meanings.sent3: The objecting cat refused to eat the new food.
meanings.sent4: His objecting expression made it clear he was not happy with the decision.
meanings.sent5: The objecting crowd's loud protests could be heard from afar.

meanings.sent1: He is objecting to the changes in the contract.
meanings.sent2: They were objecting to the noise coming from the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The dog kept objecting to the squirrel running around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The child's constant objecting was starting to annoy the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors were objecting to the new building being constructed next door.

meanings.sent1: She kept objecting to the proposed budget cuts.
meanings.sent2: The workers were objecting to the unsafe working conditions.
meanings.sent3: The objecting toddler refused to wear his shoes.
meanings.sent4: The students were objecting loudly to the school's decision to cancel the field trip.
meanings.sent5: The community members were objecting to the new zoning regulations.
